name: gatk_pipeline
title: GATK Pipeline
summary: Recalibrates mapping qualities and calls variants using GATK

inputSpec.name: mappings
inputSpec.label: Mappings table(s)
inputSpec.help: The Mappings table object(s) that will be used in this pipeline

inputSpec.name: reference
inputSpec.label: Reference genome
inputSpec.help: The reference genome used to align the mappings

inputSpec.name: output_name
inputSpec.label: Output Name
inputSpec.help: The name given to the objects output by this app (optional; if not provided, they will be called after the input Mappings object)

inputSpec.name: dbsnp
inputSpec.label: dbSNP
inputSpec.help: The dbSNP database in vcf.gz format (indexed using bgzip). For the b37 and hg19 genomes, you can find a file appropriate for this input, in the "Reference Genomes" project, "b37/GATK helpers" and "hg19/GATK helpers" subfolders.

inputSpec.name: known_indels
inputSpec.label: Known Indels
inputSpec.help: VCF files (compressed optionally) containing known indels to use in the process of realigning around the sites of known indels. For the b37 and hg19 genomes, you can find files appropriate for this input, in the "Reference Genomes" project, "b37/GATK helpers" and "hg19/GATK helpers" subfolders.

inputSpec.name: reads_per_job
inputSpec.label: Reads per Job
inputSpec.help: Controls the degree of parallelism. The number of jobs created to run the program will be the total number of reads divided by this

inputSpec.name: separate_read_groups
inputSpec.label: Separate Read Groups
inputSpec.help: If selected, the mappings in different mappings tables will be treated as belonging to different read groups. This should only be unchecked when reads from the same read group were separately uploaded and mapped to different mappings tables

inputSpec.name: discard_duplicates
inputSpec.label: Discard Duplicate Reads
inputSpec.help: If selected, duplicate mappings will be discarded during the mark duplicates step

inputSpec.name: deduplicate_interchromosome
inputSpec.label: Deduplicate Interchromosomal Pairs
inputSpec.help: If selected, the app will run additional jobs to handle deduplication of reads whose mates are mapped interchromosomally. WARNING: This option increases the run time and cost substantially

inputSpec.name: call_multiple_samples
inputSpec.label: Multiple Sample Mode
inputSpec.help: If selected, multiple mappings inputs will not be combined and will instead be separately recalibrated and will be used in multiple sample variant calling

inputSpec.name: max_interval_size
inputSpec.label: Max Interval Size
inputSpec.help: Intervals larger than this will not be used in indel realignment

inputSpec.name: min_reads_locus
inputSpec.label: Min Reads at Locus
inputSpec.help: Mimimum reads at a locus to enable using entropy calculation for indel realignment

inputSpec.name: mismatch_fraction
inputSpec.label: Mismatch Fraction
inputSpec.help: Fraction of base qualities needing to mismatch for a position to have high entropy for indel realignment target creator

inputSpec.name: window_size
inputSpec.label: Window Size
inputSpec.help: Window size for calculating entropy or SNP clusters

inputSpec.name: consensus_model
inputSpec.label: Consensus Determination Model
inputSpec.help: Determines how to compute the possible alternate consenses in indel realignment. Must be one of the following values: ["USE_READS", "KNOWNS_ONLY", "USE_SW"]

inputSpec.name: lod_threshold
inputSpec.label: LOD Cleaning Threshold
inputSpec.help: LOD threshold above which the cleaner will clean in indel realignment. This is a measure of whether improvement is significant enough to merit realignment. Lower values are recommended in cases of low coverage or looking for indels with low allele frequency

inputSpec.name: entropy_threshold
inputSpec.label: Entropy Threshold
inputSpec.help: Percentage of mismatches at a locus to be considered having high intropy in the indel realigner

inputSpec.name: max_consensuses
inputSpec.label: Max Consensuses
inputSpec.help: Max alternate consensuses to try (improves performance in deep coverage)

inputSpec.name: max_insert_size_movement
inputSpec.label: Max Insert Movement Size
inputSpec.help: Maximum insert size of read pairs that realignment attempted for

inputSpec.name: max_position_move
inputSpec.label: Max Position Move
inputSpec.help: Maximum positional move in basepairs that a read can be adjusted during realignment

inputSpec.name: max_reads_consensus
inputSpec.label: Max Reads for Consensus
inputSpec.help: Maximum reads used for finding the alternate consensuses (improves performance in deep coverage)

inputSpec.name: max_reads_realignment
inputSpec.label: Max Reads for Realignment
inputSpec.help: Maximum reads allowed at an interval for realignment

inputSpec.name: solid_recalibration_mode
inputSpec.label: SOLiD Recalibration Mode
inputSpec.help: Only applies to SOLiD sequencing. How to recalibrate bases in which the reference was inseted. If entered, must be one of the following options: ["DO_NOTHING", "SET_Q_ZERO", "SET_Q_ZERO_BASE_N", "REMOVE_REF_BIAS"]

inputSpec.name: solid_nocall_strategy
inputSpec.label: SOLiD No-call Strategy
inputSpec.help: Only applies to SOLiD sequencing. Defines behavoir when no-call encountered in color space. If entered, must be one of the following options: ["THROW_EXCEPTION", "LEAVE_READ_UNRECALIBRATED", "PURGE_READ"]

inputSpec.name: context_size
inputSpec.label: Count Covariate Context Size
inputSpec.help: Size of the k-mer context used in count covariates

inputSpec.name: nback
inputSpec.label: Count Covariates N-back
inputSpec.help: The number of previous bases to look at in HomopolymerCovariate

inputSpec.name: cycle_covariate
inputSpec.label: Use Cycle Covariate
inputSpec.help: Use cycle covariation in the quality recalibration process

inputSpec.name: dinuc_covariate
inputSpec.label: Use Dinucleotide Covariate
inputSpec.help: Use dinucleotide covariation in the quality recalibration process

inputSpec.name: primer_round_covariate
inputSpec.label: Use Primer Round Covariate
inputSpec.help: Use primer round covariation in the quality recalibration process

inputSpec.name: mapping_quality_covariate
inputSpec.label: Use Mapping Quality Covariate
inputSpec.help: Use mapping quality covariation in the quality recalibration process

inputSpec.name: homopolymer_covariate
inputSpec.label: Use Homopolymer Covariate
inputSpec.help: Use homopolymer covariation in the quality recalibration process

inputSpec.name: gc_content_covariate
inputSpec.label: Use GC Content Covariate
inputSpec.help: Use gc content covariation in the quality recalibration process

inputSpec.name: position_covariate
inputSpec.label: Use Position Covariate
inputSpec.help: Use position covariation in the quality recalibration process

inputSpec.name: minimum_nqs_covariate
inputSpec.label: Use Minimum NQS Covariate
inputSpec.help: Use minimum NQS covariation in the quality recalibration process

inputSpec.name: context_covariate
inputSpec.label: Use Context Covariate
inputSpec.help: Use context covariation in the quality recalibration process

inputSpec.name: preserve_qscore
inputSpec.label: Preserve Q-Scores Less Than
inputSpec.helP: Do not recalibrate quality scores below this threshold. Since many base callers use quality scores below 5 to indicate random or bad bases, it is often unsafe to recalibrate these bases

inputSpec.name: smoothing
inputSpec.label: Smoothing Counts
inputSpec.help: Number of imaginary counts to add to each bin in order to smooth out binds with few data points

inputSpec.name: max_quality
inputSpec.label: Maximum Quality Score
inputSpec.help: The value at which to cap the quality scores

inputSpec.name: compress_reference
inputSpec.label: Compress Reference
inputSpec.help: When selected, contiguous rows that are called as reference will be compressed to a single row to save space

inputSpec.name: infer_no_call
inputSpec.label: Infer No-call Sites
inputSpec.help: When selected, positions in the reference genome lacking any calls will be explicitly written to the variants object as no-call

inputSpec.name: compress_no_call
inputSpec.label: Compress No-call
inputSpec.help: If selected, contiguous no-calls in the genome will be condensed to one row. This often saves significant space

inputSpec.name: genotype_likelihood_model
inputSpec.label: Call SNPs or Indels
inputSpec.help: Used to call only SNPs, only Indels, or Both. Possible options:"SNP", "INDEL", "BOTH

inputSpec.name: output_mode
inputSpec.label: Output Mode
inputSpec.help: Controls how much GATK writes. Possible options are: "EMIT_VARIANTS_ONLY", "EMIT_ALL_CONFIDENT_SITES", and "EMIT_ALL_SITES". Emitting additional sites can help give an idea of effective genome coverage. WARNING: emitting all sites can take much longer

inputSpec.name: call_confidence
inputSpec.label: Call Threshold
inputSpec.help: The call quality required to call a site as variant or reference. Value is in phred-scale confidence

inputSpec.name: emit_confidence
inputSpec.label: Emit Threshold
inputSpec.help: The call quality required to write a site (could be written as no-call). Value is in phred-scale confidence

inputSpec.name: pcr_error_rate
inputSpec.label: PCR Error Rate
inputSpec.help: The assumed rate of PCR error

inputSpec.name: heterozygosity
inputSpec.label: SNP Heterozygosity
inputSpec.help: The assumed prior for the average SNP heterozygosity

inputSpec.name: indel_heterozygosity
inputSpec.label: Indel Heterozygosity
inputSpec.help: The assumed prior for the average Indel heterozygosity

inputSpec.name: minimum_base_quality
inputSpec.label: Min Base Quality
inputSpec.help: A position in a read must have at least this quality score to be considered for variant calling

inputSpec.name: max_alternate_alleles
inputSpec.label: Max Alleles
inputSpec.help: Only this many alternate alleles will be considered at a given position

inputSpec.name: max_deletion_fraction
inputSpec.label: Max Deletion Fraction
inputSpec.help: A site will be considered for SNP calling only if fewer than this fraction of reads have deletions at the position

inputSpec.name: min_indel_count
inputSpec.label: Min Indel
inputSpec.help: To be considered for an indel call, there must be at least this many reads supporting the call

inputSpec.name: non_reference_probability_model
inputSpec.label: Probability Model
inputSpec.help: What model to use for calling variants. possible options: "EXACT" or "GRID_SEARCH

inputSpec.name: intervals_to_process
inputSpec.label: Process Intervals
inputSpec.help: If given, GATK will only call variants on these regions. Input must be a string of format "-L chr:lo-hi" which can have as many -L arguments as desired

inputSpec.name: intervals_to_exclude
inputSpec.label: Exclude Intervals
inputSpec.help: If given, GATK will not call variants on these regions. Input must be a string of format "-L chr:lo-hi" which can have as many -L arguments as desired

inputSpec.name: intervals_merging
inputSpec.label: Interval Merge
inputSpec.help: If multiple intervals are given, this controls the rules by which they specify regions. Possible options are: "UNION" and "INTERSECTION". Selecting union will add all regions while intersection will only take regions contained in all of the specified intervals

inputSpec.name: downsample_to_coverage
inputSpec.label: Downsample Coverage
inputSpec.help: Sites with coverage beyond this will be randomly downsampled to this value

inputSpec.name: downsample_to_fraction
inputSpec.label: Downsample Fraction
inputSpec.help: GATK will randomly discard reads down to this fraction (1.0 keeps all reads, 0.0 discards all)

inputSpec.name: nondeterministic
inputSpec.label: Nondeterministic
inputSpec.help: By using a random seed, when this is selected the results of GATK will be slightly different each run

inputSpec.name: calculate_BAQ
inputSpec.label: Calculate BAQ
inputSpec.help: Calculate per base quality scores, another metric which can be used for filters. Possible options are: "OFF", "CALCULATE AS NECESSARY", and "RECALCULATE"

inputSpec.name: BAQ_gap_open_penalty
inputSpec.label: BAQ Gap Open Penalty
inputSpec.help: If calculate BAQ enabled, what penalty to apply to the calculated BAQ score when a gap is opened

inputSpec.name: no_output_SLOD
inputSpec.label: Don't Output SLOD
inputSpec.help: When selected, SLOD will not be calculated

inputSpec.name: max_gaussians
inputSpec.label: Max Gaussians
inputSpec.help: In variant recalibrator, the maximum number of Gaussians to try during the variantional Bayes algorithm

inputSpec.name: max_iterations
inputSpec.label: Max Iterations
inputSpec.help: In variant recalibrator, the maximum number of VBEM iterations to be performed during the variational Bayes algorithm. Procedure will normally end when convergence is detected

inputSpec.name: num_k_means
inputSpec.label: Number K Means
inputSpec.help: The number of k-means iterations to perform in order to initialize the means of the Gaussians in the Gaussian mixture model

inputSpec.name: std_threshold
inputSpec.label: Standard Deviation Threshold
inputSpec.help: In variant recalibrator, if a variant has annotations more than this many standard deviations from the mean, do not use it for the mixture model.

inputSpec.name: qual_threshold
inputSpec.label: Quality Threshold
inputSpec.help: In variant recalibrator, do not use variants with below this level of quality

inputSpec.name: shrinkage
inputSpec.label: Shrinkage
inputSpec.help: In variant recalibrator, the shrinkage parameter used in the variational Bayes algorithm

inputSpec.name: dirichlet
inputSpec.label: Dirchlet
inputSpec.help: In variant recalibrator, the dirchilet parameter used in the variantional Bayes algorithm

inputSpec.name: prior_counts
inputSpec.label: Prior Counts
inputSpec.help: In variant recalibrator, the number of prior counts to use in the variantional Bayes algorithm

inputSpec.name: fraction_bad
inputSpec.label: Fraction Bad Variants
inputSpec.help: In variant recalibrator, what percentage of the worst scoring variants to use when building the model of bad variants. e.g. 0.07 means bottom 7 percent.

inputSpec.name: min_num_bad_variants
inputSpec.label: Min Number Bad Variants
inputSpec.help: In variant recalibrator, the minimum amount of worst scoring variants to use when building the model of bad variants. Will override the Fraction Bad if necessary

inputSpec.name: ti_tv_target
inputSpec.label: Ti-Tv Target
inputSpec.help: In variant recalibrator, the expected novel Ti/Tv ratio ratio. Only used for plotting purposes

inputSpec.name: ignore_filter
inputSpec.label: Ignore Filters
inputSpec.help: In variant recalibrator, ignore the following filters

inputSpec.name: ts_filter_level
inputSpec.label: TS Filter Level
inputSpec.help: In variant recalibrator, the sensitivity level to start filtering at;.

inputSpec.name: trust_all_polymorphic
inputSpec.label: Trust All Polymorphic Sites
inputSpec.help: In variant recalibrator, trust that all the input traning sets' unfiltered records contain only polymorphic sites to drastically speed up computation

inputSpec.name: use_default_annotations
inputSpec.label: Use Default Annotations
inputSpec.help: Use the default list of annotations for variant recalibration

inputSpec.name: variant_recalibrator_annotations
inputSpec.label: Variant Recalibrator Annotations
inputSpec.help: A list of info tag annotations to use for variant recalibration. This is only applied if use_default_annotations is set to false

outputSpec.name: recalibrated_mappings
outputSpec.label: Mappings
outputSpec.help: The deduplicated and recalibrated Mappings table object.

outputSpec.name: variants
outputSpec.label: Variants
outputSpec.help: The Variants table object containing the called variants.
